Class CodeWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • CodeWriter

  • public class CodeWriter
extends java.lang.Object
    Translates the VM commands to assembly commands.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CodeWriter()
      Ctor, creates a nnw codeWriter object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void setFileName(java.lang.String fileName) 
      void writeArithmetic(java.lang.String command)
      Writes the code of arithmetic, logic, jump operations.
      void writeCall(java.lang.String functionName, int numArguments)
      Writes the translation of the call command.
      void writeCodeToFile(java.lang.String outputName)
      Writes the assembly code to an output asm file.
      void writeFunction(java.lang.String functionName, int numLocals)
      Declares a function.
      void writeGoto(java.lang.String label)
      Writes the translation of the goto command.
      void writeIf(java.lang.String label)
      Writes the translation of the if-goto command.
      void writeInit()
      Writes the bootstrap code.
      void writeLabel(java.lang.String label)
      Writes a label to the code.
      void writePushPop(CodeParser.C_TYPE command, java.lang.String segment, int index)
      Writes the code of push and pop commands.
      void writeReturn()
      Writes the translation of the return keyword.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CodeWriter

        public CodeWriter()
        Ctor, creates a nnw codeWriter object.

    • Method Detail

      • setFileName

        public void setFileName(java.lang.String fileName)

      • writeArithmetic

        public void writeArithmetic(java.lang.String command)
        Writes the code of arithmetic, logic, jump operations.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to translate.

      • writePushPop

        public void writePushPop(CodeParser.C_TYPE command,
                         java.lang.String segment,
                         int index)
        Writes the code of push and pop commands.
        Parameters:
        command - The command to translate.
        segment - The segment which the command is going to affect.
        index - The index of the command (the meaning depends on the command).

      • writeCodeToFile

        public void writeCodeToFile(java.lang.String outputName)
        Writes the assembly code to an output asm file.
        Parameters:
        outputName - The name of the output file.

      • writeInit

        public void writeInit()
        Writes the bootstrap code.

      • writeLabel

        public void writeLabel(java.lang.String label)
        Writes a label to the code.
        Parameters:
        label - The label to write.

      • writeGoto

        public void writeGoto(java.lang.String label)
        Writes the translation of the goto command.
        Parameters:
        label - The label to go to.

      • writeIf

        public void writeIf(java.lang.String label)
        Writes the translation of the if-goto command.
        Parameters:
        label - The label to go to if the condition holds.

      • writeCall

        public void writeCall(java.lang.String functionName,
                      int numArguments)
        Writes the translation of the call command. (Saves all of the data about the calling function and calling goto to the called function).
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the function to call.
        numArguments - The number of arguments that were pushed to the stack before the call.

      • writeReturn

        public void writeReturn()
        Writes the translation of the return keyword. (Restores the data of the caller function).

      • writeFunction

        public void writeFunction(java.lang.String functionName,
                          int numLocals)
        Declares a function.
        Parameters:
        functionName - The name of the function to declare.
        numLocals - The number of local arguments that the declared function has.
